title: Beloved musical ‘Show Boat’ on stage at Westchester Broadway Theatre
text:
Beloved musical ‘Show Boat’ on stage at Westchester Broadway Theatre Published 11:16 am, Wednesday, October 14, 2015 Photo: John Vecchiolla / Contributed Photo Image 1 of / 1 Close Image 1 of 1 John Preator (as Gaylord Ravenal) and Bonnie Fraser (as Magnolia Hawks) perform “It’s Only Make Believe,” in “Show Boat,” on stage at Westchester Broadway Theatre. John Preator (as Gaylord Ravenal) and Bonnie Fraser (as Magnolia Hawks) perform “It’s Only Make Believe,” in “Show Boat,” on stage at Westchester Broadway Theatre. Photo: John Vecchiolla / Contributed Photo Beloved musical ‘Show Boat’ on stage at Westchester Broadway Theatre 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
“Show Boat,” the musical that follows the lives, loves and losses of a troupe of riverboat performers on the Mississippi River,” is on stage at N.Y.’s Westchester Broadway Theatre . The beloved show is known for its timeless tunes, such as “Ol’ Man River,” “Can't Help Lovin’ Dat Man” and “Make Believe.” 
It’s also known for the way in which it illuminates the racial and social changes that were shaping the country from 1890 to 1927. For example, an interracial couple in the story finds its illegal for them to perform together in certain parts of the South. 
Jerome Kern wrote the music for “Show Boat,” while its book and lyrics are by Oscar Hammerstein II . This new production is directed and choreographed by Richard Stafford , with musical direction by Ryan Wise . 
Westchester Broadway Theatre is presenting this show through Sunday, Nov. 29, with a returning engagement from Wednesday, Dec. 30, through Sunday, Jan. 31. 
“Show Boat” opened on Broadway at the Ziegfeld Theatre on Dec. 27, 1927, and was a great success. It has been revived numerous times — most successfully by Hal Prince in 1994. Two film versions were also produced by MGM. 
Westchester Broadway Theatre, 1 Broadway Plaza, Elmsford, N.Y. Thursday, Oct. 15, 11:15 a.m. and 6:15 p.m.; Friday, Oct. 16 - Saturday, Oct. 17, 6:15 p.m.; Sunday, Oct. 18, 11:45 a.m. and 5:15 p.m.; Wednesday, Oct. 21, 11:15 a.m. Dates, times vary through Sunday, Nov. 29, then Dec. 30 to Jan. 31. Dinner and show $84 to $56 depending on performance. Beverage service and gratuities not included in price. Special offers via website. 914-592-2222, BroadwayTheatre.com
